intro: Cracca holosericea, commonly known as the silky cracca, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, hairy stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in clusters, and bloom during the warmer months. Cracca holosericea is often found in grasslands and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
